result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond J Lizardi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raymond J Lizardi is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raymond J Lizardi was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Raymond J Lizardi was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with LBH.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Hearing held by Zoom.  Defendant did not appear.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent  Sam Lash appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Lillian Rose Nelson appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Agent Lash: client is currently absconding status, and does have outstanding restitution and they did add AODA as a condition.  ADA: is this a situation where a warrant can be issued.  Agent Lash: there are two current warrants out for his arrest.  ADA: asking for a body only warrant.  Court: will issue a body only warrant, also speaks to request for extension of probation. ADA: requests the extension be granted for 1 year.  CT: questions what a body only bench warrant would do if extension is granted?  ADA: withdraws request for body only bench warrant.  CT: will extend probation on count 3 for 1 more year or until AODA is completed and restitution is paid.  Court adjourned.
Probation review hearing on October 11, 2021 at 01:30 pm.
